title: SQLExercises

metadata.description: Learn about SQLExercises with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Exercises
Test your SQL skills with exercises from all categories:
Syntax
Select

Where
Order By

Or
Not
Insert Into
Null Values
Update
Delete

Min and Max

Right Join
Full Join

Having
Exists
Any, All
Select Into
Insert Into Select
CASE Expression
NULL Functions
Stored Procedures
Comments
Operators
Create Database
Drop Database
Backup Database

Drop Table
Alter Table

Not Null

Foreign Key
Check
Default
Create Index
Auto Increment
Dates
View
Injection
Hosting
Data Types

If you haven't already,

to become a W3Schooler, and get points for every exercise you complete.
As a logged on  user you will have access to many features like having
your own web page
,
track your learning progress
,
receive personal guided paths
, and
more
.
The Exercise
The exercises are a mix of "multiple choice" and "fill in the blanks" questions. 
There are between 3 and 9 questions in  each catergory.
The answer can be found in the corresponding tutorial chapter. If you're stuck, 
or answer wrong, you can try again or hit the "Show Answer" button to see the correct answer.

summary: This tutorial covers SQLExercises concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use SQLExercises effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of SQLExercises and how to apply it in your projects.
